stories.text: I’m working on a project that I want to open source, but it uses an API key that I want to keep hidden from untrusted parties. What’s best practice on how to do that? Google is really vague about “encrypting” it.
stories.title: Ask HN: What’s best practice for securing API keys in open source projects?
Uber and Dig Lure New Yorkers by Making Fun of Grubhub Debacle

stories.text:
Hey HN!

If you're fed up with how Ctrl+F works and can't seem to find what you need on websites, check out this chrome extension.

It performs simple searches locally. Advanced searches get sent to a secure backend for inference. Nothing is ever saved or recorded.

Let me know what you think.
stories.title: Show HN: Ctrl+F with Semantics
